article.headline: UAB reaches  20 wins for 14th time in history
article.linkText: UAB earns milestone win over Louisiana-Lafayette
article.story:
BIRMINGHAM, Ala. -- Gabe Kennedy scored 19 points 
and Morris Finley added 17 as UAB posted an 82-80 victory over
Louisiana-Lafayette in the first round of the Owens Corning National
Invitation Tournament.

Kennedy made 6-of-9 field goals and 7-of-8 free throws before
fouling out.

Eric Bush chipped in with 15 points for the Blazers (20-12),
including nine in the final five minutes.

UAB, which lost to Louisville on Saturday in the finals of the
Conference USA tournament, reached 20 wins for the 14th time in
school history.

Brad Boyd made five 3-pointers and scored 26 points for the
Ragin' Cajuns (20-10), who ended the season with three straight
losses. Louisiana-Lafayette became the first top seed in the Sun
Belt Conference to lose in the first round of the conference
tournament since 1983.

UAB will take on either Siena or Western Michigan in the second
round.
